title: Portfolio Strategy: Diversification Versus Concentration
text: A subject that investors often ask me about is position sizing within a portfolio.

title: EIA reports a fifth straight weekly fall in U.S. crude-oil supplies
text: The Energy Information Administration on Wednesday reported that U.S. crude supplies fell for a fifth consecutive week, but by less than the market expected.

title: Mixed Housing Data for June
text: Housing Starts and Building Permits for June — metrics that are essential for tracking overall domestic economic growth — came in mixed this morning.

title: 3 Hot Investing Trends: Next Steps and Big Opportunities
text: The profit potential for investors who get in early on the marijuana, transportation and 5G trends is massive. Here's a quick update on each theme.

title: Wednesday's Market Minute: The Utility Of Bitcoin
text: A lot of explanations have been given for Bitcoin's big move this year: Wall Street institutional interest, progress in market structure, gold-like accumulation as a hedge against central bank extravagance, Chinese wealth transfer, excitement around Facebook.com, Inc.

title: Dow slips and the stock market treads water at the open as investors digest earnings from B.of A.
text: U.S. stock indexes tread water at the start of trading Wednesday, with investors finding few reasons to take benchmarks further into record territory, amid a round of earnings from U.S. corporations.

title: What the market is getting wrong about earnings and trade
text: Investors are getting something very wrong about the U.S.-China trade war, warns Lindsey Bell of CFRA Research.

title: Stock Futures Flat, Chips Lead Nasdaq, Dow Jones; CSX, Railroads Dive
text:
Qualcomm and ASML Holding led, while CSX lagged as stock futures hovered in flat trade Wednesday.

title: A 'bear market checklist' from Citi says one is nowhere close
text: Citi Research has an 18-item checklist to identify whether global markets are entering into a "bear period."

title: Buying stocks when they are this expensive has led to low returns in the future
text: Buying stocks when they are this expensive has historically led to lower returns, data compiled by Ned Davis Research shows.

title: Loan apps exposed real-time location data on millions in China     - CNET
text: Exclusive: More than 100 apps for loans in China have been sending data to an unprotected server, exposing how much money people owe and where they are.

title: Mortgage Loan Rates on the Rise Again
text: The Mortgage Bankers Association (MBA) released its weekly report on mortgage applications Wednesday morning, noting a decrease of 1.1% in the group’s seasonally adjusted composite index for the week ending July 12.

title: Dow Jones Futures: Chips Rally On ASML, Qualcomm As EU Probes Amazon; Here Comes Netflix
text: Dow Jones futures: Chip stocks rallied on good news for ASML and Qualcomm. The EU will probe Amazon while Netflix earnings are on tap.

title: The market is nearing a milestone that could be more important than Dow 27,000, S&P 500 3000
text: If the S&P 500 climbs another 4%, it will have doubled the peak reached in the previous bull market, Michael Santoli notes.

title: Futures flat as investors weigh bank results
text: Worries about the balance of monetary policy and growth kept U.S. stock futures flat on Wednesday, subduing the impact of solid results from Bank of America and a boost for chipmakers from Dutch company ASML.

title: Where Are Gold And Crude Oil Headed Now?
text: Both gold and crude oil have been getting more attention in the financial press recently. Do the weekly charts of either commodity or the dollar indicate that the recent price action signals a change in trend?

title: Libra's Scrutiny Pushed Bitcoin Price Lower, How Low Will It Go?
text: Facebook's Libra is a project which is going to provide a combination of tail and headwind for the Bitcoin price. The crypto king's price has touched a critical moving average and the battle is on between bulls and bears.

title: Bills targeting China's Huawei introduced in Congress
text: Members of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives introduced bills on Tuesday to keep tight restrictions on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, amid concern about President Donald Trump's easing of curbs on the Chinese firm.

title: Debt and dollar in demand, sterling and stocks stricken on trade war and Brexit
text: Resurgent trade tensions, concern over the outlook for corporate America and the growing risk of a chaotic Brexit in the United Kingdom dampened appetite for equities on Wednesday while keeping alive interest in the dollar and government bonds.

title: Stocks Mixed As Trade Worries Linger; Dollar Gains: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks in Europe drifted, futures edged higher and Asian shares were mostly down as continuing U.S.-China trade tensions offset a solid corporate data.

title: Making sense of chaos? Algos scour social media for clues to crypto moves
text: After months of relative calm in cryptocurrency markets, bitcoin exploded back into life in April with its sharpest price jump in over a year - but few people could convincingly explain why.

title: How lithium-rich Chile botched a plan to attract battery makers
text: In March 2018, the Chilean government unveiled big news: Corporate investors, including South Korean electronics giant Samsung, would build three factories in Chile to produce battery parts for electric vehicles.

title: South Korea-Japan trade fight risks 'further escalation'
text: As the trade battle between South Korea and Japan drags on, Seoul announced it will cut down its economic dependence on Japanese industries.

title: Bad sign for commercial real estate: The architecture business is slowing down
text: A key read on the industry, the Architecture Billings Index, fell into negative territory in June, according to the American Institute for Architects. Inquiries for new projects hit a decade low, while design contracts also fell.
